intro: Ilex paucinervis, commonly known as the few-veined holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Ilex paucinervis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Aquifoliaceae family.
